reviews.review_msg: Bruce is a passionate professor. He enjoys talking about his research and family to incorporate to the concepts. The TA is amazing and provided helpful feedback. I find the lectures a bit long and the material is a lot to handle for one lecture. Each lecture is about 120 slides and sometimes he does not have time to finish the content

Bruce is amazing and his lectures are interesting to listen to. Brings his own knowledge and research. An A is a 90 but easy if you complete all assignments and put in effort. 2 writing assignments and a midterm. Con: doesnt record lectures, but you dont even rlly have to go after the midterm. And hes funny. Highly recommend!

Mid. I was expecting more from the class given the course description and the ratings here! Heavily focused on historical diseases (I.E. measles, smallpox, etc.) as opposed to public health. Also, occasional questionable comments made in lectures. Not the worst, but not the best. Would not take again.

Prof is knowledgeable about the material and very approachable, but the course is basically a history of public health and his own research in lead. It's interesting stuff but fairly useless unless you want to do research on environmental pollutants. Emphasis on prevention over cure. Grading scheme is set up so that 93% is an A.

Bruce is a great guy. You can tell he is passionate about what he teaches which makes a huge difference. He brings fresh perspectives to topics that you may have some previous knowledge of which means you will never be bored. You need to be in class if you want to get good grades, as his slides are mainly references/photos

Bruce is the real life embodiment of a Hollywood professor. You know? The kind you see in the movies. His thought provoking lectures will leave you thinking about broader global health issues the rest of your week. If you are interested in the history of infectious disease, this is your class. Show up to lectures - you will not be disappointed!

Just an all around inspiring prof. Super friendly and loves his students. Gives such good talks and really wants to share his experiences and why students should care about topics regarding our environment. Always open to help and super fair in his marking. One of the best profs in health science without question

Over 5 years at SFU, no professor has influenced my life like Bruce. He is one of the most respected in the field of environmental toxicants, but also an amazing teacher. He makes class incredibly engaging and gives great feedback on all assignments. If you are in the faculty of HSCI or are just looking to take an elective, take this.
